extendedInfo.description: GHOSTPHONE WORKS ON ANDROID VERSIONS 2.0 OR HIGHER. However, here's a special note just for those using versions 3.1 or higher: When you start GhostPhone for the very first time (or if you manually stop it from the "Manage application" menu), before starting GhostPhone by calling the 9991 number, you must first run the "Glass Wallpaper" app from the Home Screen.GhostPhone is an application that allows you to manage calls and messages (also MMS from Android 2.2+) in a completely anonymous way. The calls sent/received and the messages sent/received are not recorded in the standard log of the phone. The application allows you to manage reserved contacts from a special phonebook, where you can make calls and send messages without leaving any trace. Messages received from a reserved contact in the GhostPhone phonebook are not logged in inbox, but are registered in the GhostPhone reserved list of messages. GhostPhone is not present among the applications that run from the Home screen of your phone, but you must start it by calling the special number 9991. As you can see for yourself the features of the Ghostphone phonebook are similar to the standard phonebook. Obviously, through the 'Settings' menu you can customize the number to call to access the GhostPhone as well as many other features. Forgot your PIN access code? Call 9999 to receive it on your email. Make your phone vanish into thin air! Try GhostPhone!GhostPhone doesn't work with a third part messaging app? Try this:1. Uninstall GhostPhone and third part messaging app.2. First install GhostPhone.3. Then install third part messaging app.Enjoy!ATTENTION: BEFORE YOU INSTALL THE FULL VERSION PLEASE UNINSTALL THE TRIAL VERSION.

reviews.title: Handy but....
reviews.comment: it works and then i suddenly realized it can be found at the recent.task list. The program appeared as a dialer apps in the list and can be assesed without passqord. Hope to be fixed soon.

reviews.title: Unique, Sensitive Call/Txt Hiding App
reviews.comment: Allows me to keep my sensitive calls/texts away from prying eyes, through a unique layer of \'security by obscurity.\'
